name: Bug Report (Worst Bug Found Prize)
about: Report a bug in the Huitzo SDK or platform. Critical bugs are eligible for the $100 Worst Bug Found prize!
title: "[BUG] "
labels: bug, hackathon
assignees: ''
---

## Bug Description

**What happened?**
A clear, concise description of the bug.

## Severity

How critical is this bug? (Check one)

- [ ] **Critical** - Blocks core functionality, data loss, or security issue
- [ ] **High** - Major feature broken, no workaround
- [ ] **Medium** - Feature broken, but workaround exists
- [ ] **Low** - Minor issue, cosmetic, or edge case

## Reproduction Steps

1. Go to '...'
2. Run command '...'
3. Pass input '...'
4. See error

## Expected Behavior

What should have happened?

## Actual Behavior

What actually happened? Include error messages, stack traces, or unexpected output.

## Environment

- **OS**: [e.g., macOS 14, Ubuntu 22.04, Windows 11]
- **Python version**: [e.g., 3.12.1]
- **Huitzo SDK version**: [e.g., 0.1.0]
- **Starter template**: [e.g., 01-smart-notes, custom pack]

## Screenshots / Logs

If applicable, add screenshots or paste relevant log output.

```
Paste logs here
```

## Impact Assessment

**Who does this affect?**
- [ ] All users
- [ ] Users of a specific template
- [ ] Users on a specific OS/platform
- [ ] Edge case / rare scenario

**What functionality is broken?**
Describe what users cannot do because of this bug.

## Already Reported?

- [ ] I searched existing issues and this bug has not been reported yet

## Prize Eligibility Checklist

For the **Worst Bug Found ($100)** prize, your report should meet these criteria:

- [ ] Bug is reproducible (someone else can follow your steps and see the same issue)
- [ ] Bug is not already reported in an existing issue
- [ ] Bug affects core functionality or developer experience
- [ ] Report includes clear reproduction steps
- [ ] Report includes environment details
